qas.question: What unique form of dance originated in the neighbourhods of Montevideo?
Tango, candombe and murga are three main styles of what?
How many movie theater companies are there in Montevideo?
What is the most prominent theater in Uruguay?

context: Montevideo has a very rich architectural heritage and an impressive number of writers, artists, and musicians. <a0_0>Uruguayan tango<a0_0/> is a unique form of dance that originated in the neighbourhoods of Montevideo towards the end of the 1800s. Tango, candombe and murga are the three main styles of <a1_0>music<a1_0/> in this city. The city is also the centre of the cinema of Uruguay, which includes commercial, documentary and experimental films. There are <a2_0>two<a2_0/> movie theatre companies running seven cinemas, around ten independent ones and four art film cinemas in the city. The theatre of Uruguay is admired inside and outside Uruguayan borders. <a3_0>The Solís Theatre<a3_0/> is the most prominent theatre in Uruguay and the oldest in South America. There are several notable theatrical companies and thousands of professional actors and amateurs. Montevideo playwrights produce dozens of works each year; of major note are Mauricio Rosencof, Ana Magnabosco and Ricardo Prieto.
